condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Sched 2, Sect 1(A)2 | Description :Recipient shall monitor and evaluate progress, and prepare Project Reportscovering one calendar semester, furnished to IDA no later than 2 months after end of period covered. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Sched 2, Sect 1(B)2 | Description :Recipient shall prepare and furnish to IDA no later than 45 days after end ofeach calendar quarter, unaudited interim financial reports covering the quarter | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Sched 2, Sect 1(B)3 | Description :Recipient shall have financial statements audited, each audit covering onefiscal year of the Recipient, and furnish audit to IDA no later than six months after end of such period. | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: Establishment of system of in-service training allowing provision of non-government institutions
Technically adequate sample-based student assessment is implemented
New curriculum officially adopted in Grade 1-8
Utility of the learning assessment system
System for learning assessment at the primary level
Number of teachers participating in new curriculum related in-service training
% of population understanding and supporting education reforms.

baseline.value: 2010 Survey: 94% of parents positively evaluated the impact of new curriculum on pupil's development.72.4% of teachers werepartly or completely satisfied with education reforms. 99.2% of principals were satisfied with education reformsoverall: 88.5%satisfied

target.value: Percent support the same or improved compared to baseline.

title.narrative: Increased proportion of teachers using active methodologies in the context of the new curriculum.

baseline.value: 2010 survey results: 10.6% of teachers used active learning64% used mixed methods 26% used only traditional

title.narrative: % of population that recognizes the importance of pre-school for a child's school readiness.

baseline.value: In 2010, survey respondents valuing the importance of preschool education: - 90.4% of school principals- 82.2% of teachers -88.9% of parents.Overall 87.7%

target.value: Above 97% for school principals; Above 86% for teachers;Above 83% for parents
